Waterbear Field School

Hands-on community workshops teaching energy, water, food, shelter, climate, communication, fabrication, transport, arts & crafts.

Winter 2026 Resilience Sequence

Four consecutive weeks of hands-on workshops covering energy, climate, communication, and transport. Join a cohort of fellow learners and build practical skills for resilience.

Location: Greater Boston Area
Dates: February 2026 (specific dates TBD)
Price: $275 ($250 early bird)

The Workshops

‚ö° Energy

A Gentle Introduction to Local Energy Resilience

A hands-on introduction to human-scale renewable energy‚Äîbuild intuition for what's possible and learn practical approaches to generating and using power off-grid.

DIY Air Filtration

Learn how to build and assess simple, low-cost, effective DIY air purifiers.

Texting When the Grid Isn't Available

Learn how to set up and use off-grid communications tools locally using inexpensive new tools that don't require a license.
üö≤ Transport

DIY Bike Trailers

Build a low-cost cargo bike trailer from readily-available hardware store materials

What's Included

  • All four workshops (normally ~$320 if taken separately)
  • Materials for all projects
  • Take-home: solar charger, air filter, mesh radio, bike trailer
  • Certificate of completion for the Resilience Foundations credential
